unnormalised: Heads up, folks planning those big fat Indian weddings! Mark your calendars 'cause the dates are out for the next 2 years – and they're gonna be jam-packed. Astrologers are saying Nov 2024 has some super auspicious days starting right after Diwali, which falls on 31/10/2024.
normalised: Heads up, folks planning those big fat Indian weddings! Mark your calendars because the dates are out for the next two years – and they're gonna be jam-packed. Astrologers are saying November two thousand and twenty four has some super auspicious days starting right after Diwali, which falls on thirty one October two thousand and twenty four.

unnormalised: Apparently, a LOT of families are eyeing those dates 'cause you know, good muhurat equals a happy marriage, right? Then you've got the whole of Dec '24, but remember, everything kinda slows down around 25/12 for Christmas and New Year's.
normalised: Apparently, a lot of families are eyeing those dates because you know, good muhurat equals a happy marriage, right? Then you've got the whole of December two thousand and twenty four, but remember, everything kind of slows down around twenty five December for Christmas and New Year's.

unnormalised: Moving into 2025, Jan looks promising, especially around Makar Sankranti on 14/01/2025. Avoid the Chaturmas period though, which starts sometime in July (exact date to be announced) and lasts for like, 4 months. No weddings then, strictly.
normalised: Moving into two thousand and twenty five, January looks promising, especially around Makar Sankranti on fourteen January two thousand and twenty five. Avoid the Chaturmas period though, which starts sometime in July (exact date to be announced) and lasts for like, four months. No weddings then, strictly.

unnormalised: And for those thinking ahead, Nov-Dec '25 also look pretty sweet. Just keep an eye out for the Panchang 'cause you never know when some unexpected Rahu Kalam might pop up and mess with your plans. Best to consult your family pandit ji.
normalised: And for those thinking ahead, November December two thousand and twenty five also look pretty sweet. Just keep an eye out for the Panchang because you never know when some unexpected Rahu Kalam might pop up and mess with your plans. Best to consult your family pandit ji.

unnormalised: So, start booking those venues and caterers now, people. Seriously. You don't want to be scrambling at the last minute. Happy planning!
normalised: So, start booking those venues and caterers now, people. Seriously. You don't want to be scrambling at the last minute. Happy planning!
